intro: Schwenckia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, seed-filled spheres. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Schwenckia pubescens is an important plant for pollinators and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
